snippet: The United Federation of Teachers and the Bloomberg administration blamed each other for talks breaking down even as a midnight deadline approached.
abstract: New York City officials and teacher's union fail to reach agreement on new system of evaluating 75,000 public school teachers; put city into immediate danger of losing out on up to $450 million in state and federal money, and raise possibility of cuts to staff and programs.

byline.original: By AL BAKER and MARC SANTORA

lead_paragraph: The United Federation of Teachers and the Bloomberg administration blamed each other for talks breaking down even as a midnight deadline approached.

headline.seo: No Deal on New York City Teacher Evaluations; State and Federal Money at Risk
headline.main: No Deal on Teacher Evaluations; City Risks Losing $450 Million
headline.print_headline: No Deal on Teacher Evaluations; City Risks Losing $450 Million
